intro: Miconia bordoncilloana, commonly known as the yellow miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy yellow flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. It is often found in lowland forests and is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
